    <item>
      <title>Facebook, Facing Bias Claims, Shows How Editors and Algorithms Guide News</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/facebook-guidelines-trending-topics.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/facebook-guidelines-trending-topics.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/facebook-guidelines-trending-topics.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <media:content url="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2016/05/13/business/13FACEBOOK/13FACEBOOK-moth-v2.jpg" medium="image" height="151" width="151"/>
      <media:description>Mark Zuckerberg, the chief of Facebook, which detailed how both editors and computer algorithms play roles in the process of picking what appears in the “Trending Topics” section of Facebook pages.</media:description>
      <media:credit>Chandan Khanna/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images</media:credit>
      <description>Accused of political bias, the company offered details on how human editors and algorithms choose what appears — or doesn’t appear — in “Trending Topics.”</description>
      <dc:creator>MIKE ISAAC</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:34:11 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Facebook Inc</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Social Media</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">News and News Media</category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Apple Puts $1 Billion in Didi, a Rival to Uber in China</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/apple-puts-1-billion-in-didi-a-rival-to-uber-in-china.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/apple-puts-1-billion-in-didi-a-rival-to-uber-in-china.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/apple-puts-1-billion-in-didi-a-rival-to-uber-in-china.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <description>The investment gives the tech giant a big stake in the top ride-hailing service in China, where the iPhone maker has otherwise struggled.</description>
      <dc:creator>MIKE ISAAC and VINDU GOEL</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:07:41 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Apple Inc</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_geo">China</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Didi Chuxing</category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Brooklyn Judge Will Not Force Facebook’s Silence on Subpoenas</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/brooklyn-judge-will-not-force-facebooks-silence-on-subpoenas.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/brooklyn-judge-will-not-force-facebooks-silence-on-subpoenas.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/brooklyn-judge-will-not-force-facebooks-silence-on-subpoenas.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <description>Prosecutors wanted to keep Facebook from telling users about 15 subpoenas of their data. But a judge refused, saying the need for them was not specific enough.</description>
      <dc:creator>ALAN FEUER</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:58:20 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Facebook Inc</category>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Subpoenas</category>

      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/nyt_org_all">Microsoft Corp</category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Op-Ed Contributor: Privacy Rules Shouldn’t Handcuff the S.E.C.</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/opinion/privacy-rules-shouldnt-handcuff-the-sec.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/opinion/privacy-rules-shouldnt-handcuff-the-sec.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/opinion/privacy-rules-shouldnt-handcuff-the-sec.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <media:content url="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2016/05/13/opinion/13whiteWeb/13whiteWeb-moth.jpg" medium="image" height="151" width="151"/>
      <media:description>Martin Shkreli, right, appeared in court last week on charges of fraud brought by the Securities and Exchange Commission.</media:description>
      <media:credit>Eduardo Munoz Alvarez/Getty Images</media:credit>
      <description>A new bill would deprive government agencies of important tools to fight crime. Our solution would respect privacy without harming our mandate.</description>
      <dc:creator>MARY JO WHITE</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:10:02 GMT</pubDate>

      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/mdes">Subpoenas</category>

    </item>

    <item>
      <title>Tech Tip: Changing Android’s Default Apps</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/personaltech/changing-androids-default-apps.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/personaltech/changing-androids-default-apps.html</guid>

      <media:description>In Android 6.0, you can select the browser of your choice in the Default Apps section of the settings.</media:description>
      <media:credit>The New York Times</media:credit>
      <description>If you want to use something other than Google’s own Chrome browser as your go-to app, you can choose a different program.</description>

    <item>
      <title>Emojis Would Show Women Doing More Than Painting Their Nails</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/emojis-women-professional-roles.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/13/technology/emojis-women-professional-roles.html</guid>

      <media:description>A team of Google employees proposed adding new emojis to represent women, and their male counterparts, in professional roles.</media:description>
      <media:credit>Google</media:credit>
      <description>Google wants to add 13 emojis to represent women, and men too, in professional roles in business, health care, factory work and farming.</description>
      <dc:creator>KAREN WORKMAN</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 13:07:16 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Emojis and Emoticons</category>

    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Pentagon Turns to Silicon Valley for Edge in Artificial Intelligence</title>

    <item>
      <title>The Great Instagram Logo Freakout of 2016</title>

    <item>
      <title>On Money: Bubble Indemnity</title>

    <item>
      <title>Crowdsourcing to Get Ideas, and Perhaps Save Money</title>

      <title>Suicide on Periscope Prompts French Officials to Open Inquiry</title>

      <media:description>The Égly station, about 25 miles south of Paris, on Wednesday. A young woman threw herself under a train at the Égly station while recording herself on Periscope on Tuesday.</media:description>

      <description>Officials are looking into an episode in which a young woman recorded herself jumping in front of a train outside Paris on the live video-streaming app.</description>

    <item>
      <title>E.U. Regulators Block Merger of British Mobile Carriers on Competition Grounds</title>
      <link>http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/12/business/international/three-o2-merger-blocked-eu.html?partner=rss&emc=rss</link>
      <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/12/business/international/three-o2-merger-blocked-eu.html</guid>
      <atom:link rel="standout" href="http://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/12/business/international/three-o2-merger-blocked-eu.html?partner=rss&emc=rss"/>
      <media:content url="https://static01.nyt.com/images/2016/05/05/nytnow/05EUtelecome/05EUtelecome-moth.jpg" medium="image" height="151" width="151"/>
      <media:description>The Munich offices of the Spanish telecommunications giant Telefónica, which owns O2.</media:description>
      <media:credit>Sven Hoppe/European Pressphoto Agency</media:credit>
      <description>The acquisition of O2 by Hutchison Whampoa, the owner of the operator Three, would have harmed consumer choice, the bloc’s antitrust chief said.</description>
      <dc:creator>MARK SCOTT</dc:creator>
      <pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 10:47:55 GMT</pubDate>
      <category domain="http://www.nytimes.com/namespaces/keywords/des">Telephones and Telecommunications</category>

    </item>
